newsitem.title: USA: ICE HOCKEY-Connecticut approves $20.5 mln Whalers exit deal.
newsitem.headline: ICE HOCKEY-Connecticut approves $20.5 mln Whalers exit deal.

text.p: The Connecticut Development Authority on Wednesday approved a $20.5 million agreement allowing the National Hockey League's Hartford Whalers to leave the state immediately, a spokesman for Gov. John Rowland said.
The approval clears the way for the team to move to North Carolina next season, where the club will compete as the Carolina Hurricanes.
The exit agreement was negotiated in March between Rowland and team owner Peter Karmanos.

Connecticut House Speaker Tom Ritter had sharply criticized the agreement, saying the team should be forced to pay twice as much for ending their lease on the Hartford Civic Center a year earlier than scheduled. The arena is owned by the Connecticut Development Authority.
The team will pay the state $20.5 million over 15 years, with the first installment of $5 million is due on July 1.
Connecticut retains the rights to the "Whalers" name and all team logos and colors.
